presentingConcerns.description: Generalized anxiety with excessive worry about work performance, relationships, and health outcomes
presentingConcerns.duration: Approximately 2 years, worsening over past 6 months
presentingConcerns.impact: Difficulty concentrating at work, sleep disturbance (4-5 hours/night), avoidance of social situations

presentingConcerns.description: Low mood and anhedonia, particularly on weekends when not occupied with work
presentingConcerns.impact: Reduced engagement in previously enjoyed activities, social withdrawal from friends

clinicalImpressions.observation: Client demonstrates good insight into anxiety triggers but shows cognitive distortions including catastrophizing and mind-reading
Client presents as articulate and engaged, maintains appropriate eye contact, affect congruent with content
Reports chronic muscle tension, particularly in shoulders and jaw, consistent with anxiety presentation
Client expresses feelings of isolation despite having supportive family system

diagnoses.name: Generalized Anxiety Disorder
diagnoses.notes: Meets criteria for excessive worry, difficulty controlling worry, and associated symptoms (sleep disturbance, muscle tension, concentration difficulties) for >6 months. Will continue assessment.

diagnoses.name: Major Depressive Episode, Mild
diagnoses.notes: Some depressive symptoms present but may be secondary to anxiety. Monitor for worsening or persistence.

goals.description: Reduce frequency of anxiety episodes from daily to 3 or fewer per week
goals.measurableOutcome: Client self-report using anxiety tracking app; reduction in PHQ-9 scores by 25%

goals.description: Improve sleep quality to achieve 6-7 hours of restful sleep per night
goals.measurableOutcome: Sleep diary showing average of 6+ hours sleep with <30 min to fall asleep

goals.description: Develop sustainable coping strategies for managing anxiety without avoidance
goals.measurableOutcome: Demonstrate use of at least 3 coping strategies in anxiety-provoking situations; GAD-7 score <10

goals.description: Increase engagement in social activities and rebuild connection with friends
goals.measurableOutcome: Attend at least 2 social activities per month; report improved satisfaction with relationships

interventions.name: Cognitive Restructuring
interventions.description: Identify and challenge anxious automatic thoughts using thought records. Focus on catastrophizing and probability overestimation.
interventions.frequency: Daily thought record practice; review in weekly sessions
interventions.rationale: Evidence-based approach for addressing cognitive distortions characteristic of GAD

interventions.name: Diaphragmatic Breathing
interventions.description: 4-7-8 breathing technique for acute anxiety management. Practice activating parasympathetic nervous system response.
interventions.frequency: 3x daily scheduled practice + use during anxiety episodes
interventions.rationale: Physiological intervention to reduce somatic anxiety symptoms and interrupt anxiety escalation

interventions.name: Sleep Hygiene Protocol
interventions.description: Implement consistent sleep schedule, limit screen time 1 hour before bed, create relaxing bedtime routine, address worry time before bed.
interventions.rationale: Address sleep disturbance which exacerbates anxiety symptoms; improve overall functioning

strengths.description: High motivation for treatment and willingness to engage in homework assignments
Good insight into anxiety patterns and triggers
Supportive family system including partner and parents
Stable employment with flexible schedule that accommodates therapy
History of successful stress management through exercise

riskFactors.description: Work stress with upcoming project deadline may exacerbate symptoms

homework.title: Daily Thought Record
homework.description: Complete at least one thought record each day, documenting the situation, automatic thought, emotion, evidence for/against, and balanced thought.
homework.rationale: Build awareness of cognitive patterns and practice cognitive restructuring skills

homework.title: Breathing Practice Log
homework.description: Practice 4-7-8 breathing technique 3 times daily (morning, midday, evening) and log in app. Note any use during anxiety episodes.
homework.rationale: Develop automatic relaxation response through consistent practice

homework.title: Sleep Diary
homework.description: Track sleep patterns including bedtime, wake time, estimated time to fall asleep, and sleep quality rating (1-10).
homework.rationale: Establish baseline and track progress on sleep goal
